entries.content: Frame product value by highlighting how it solves common problems associated with traditional methods, rather than directly attacking competitors.
Contrast the ease and benefits of your solution with the typical hassles or costs of existing alternatives.
It saves you a ton of money on roaming fees.
entries.notes: Frames value by highlighting cost savings vs. a common problem.

entries.content: Provides you an internet connection wherever you travel.
entries.notes: Frames value as a solution to a connectivity need.

entries.content: No more ducking in and out of cafes for Wi-Fi.
entries.notes: Frames value (constant access) by contrasting with a common workaround for the problem.

entries.content: No more waiting in line at the airport for a physical SIM card or fumbling to switch one out.
entries.notes: Frames value (convenience) by contrasting with the hassle of the traditional method.

entries.content: The eSIM just needs to be installed once, eliminating the need for users to install [multiple times for multiple countries].
entries.notes: Frames value (simplicity for multi-country travel) by contrasting with traditional complexity.

entries.content: A [Product Name] is really a traveler's best friend. It's the best decision you can make before going to another country.
entries.notes: Strong positive framing of overall value and recommendation.

entries.content: Illustrate the problem your product solves with a relatable anecdote, like a colleague needing a hotspot to avoid roaming charges.
entries.notes: Uses a specific example to highlight the pain point addressed by the unique value.

focus_area: Competitive Objections: Unique value framing without attacking others
